Detailed Description

This is the main starting point for the APOXI Audio API. This is a singleton - use GetInstance().

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef AudioAccessoryStore::AccessoryList AudioDeviceManager::AccessoryList
 

typedef void(* AudioDeviceManager::OnAudioMessageCallback)(const Message *message, void *pUserData)
 

This is the type of callback functions that can be registered as audio message handlers. See SubscribeAudioMessageCallback.

Parameters:
Message the message to be handled
The pUserData parameter previously provided to SubscribeAudioMessageCallback().

typedef AudioPlayer::AudioSourceType AudioDeviceManager::SourceType
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AudioDeviceManager::AudioDeviceID
 

List of audio devices available. Note: Not all devices are lised here. See GetDevice.

Enumerator:
ToneDeviceID  DSP tone player.
RingerDeviceID  External ringer player.
MIDIRingerDeviceID  Internal ringer player.
VoiceMemoDeviceID  Voice memo (AMR) player.
PCMDeviceID  PCM player.
MP3DeviceID  MP3 player.
SpeechDeviceID  Speech channel.
VibratorDeviceID  VibratorDeviceID is used only for E-Gold based platforms.
RadioDeviceID  FM radio device.
YamahaMapiId  device for Yamaha music API (MAPI)
AudioDeviceEndId

SharedPtr< AudioReference > AudioDeviceManager::CreateAudioReferenceFromBinData (  MimeType  mime_type,
BinData *  bin_data
) 
 

Creates an AudioReference to audio data from a BinData.

Parameters:
mime_type The mime type of the audio data
bin_data The pointer to the BinData object which contains the audio data. The desctruction of the BinData is in responsibility of the application.
Note:
The non standard MIME types are defined as AudioCustomMimeTypeId in Project.hpp

This method is introduced to support the creation of AudioReferences from data sources which are not covered by the four methods above (basically for future needs).

Note:
The non standard MIME types are defined as AudioCustomMimeTypeId in Project.hpp

SharedPtr< AudioReference > AudioDeviceManager::CreateAudioReferenceFromRFS (  const Path &  path  ) 
 

Get an AudioReference for the file in the Root File System.

Parameters:
path Root File System file.
Returns:
A new AudioReference.
This function creates an Audio Reference in RFS (FFS or MMC).

For the supported formats see the following table:
ExtensionMIME TypeAudio Type
.mmfapplication/x-smafYamaha SMAF and SMAF/Phrase
.spfapplication/vnd.yamaha.smaf-phraseYamaha SMAF/Phrase
.amraudio/amrAdaptive multi rate
.imyaudio/imelodyImelody
.midaudio/midiMIDI
.midiaudio/midiMIDI
.mp3audio/mpegMPEG Layer-3
.wavaudio/x-wavPCM

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceManager::EnableMasterMute (  BOOLEAN  enable = TRUE  )  [static]
 

Mutes/unmutes master volume.

Note:
This function should be used for muting the volume for all devices. If there is a need to mute volume for some particular device, use AudioDeviceBase::Mute() for that device
Parameters:
mute if TRUE mute, else unmute
Returns:
indicates success.

Parameters:

Returns:
A suitable AudioPlayer.

AudioDeviceBase * AudioDeviceManager::GetDevice (  AudioDeviceID  device  ) 
 

Get a player for this device-ID.

Deprecated, use at your own risk. An application should never have to obtain an AudioPlayer in this way; instead, it should use AudioActiveReference::GetDevice. The danger in using AudioDeviceManager::GetDevice for obtaining the AudioPlayer that is used to play an AudioReference is that you have to guess, and you may guess wrong; player selection is done at Play() time, and before that there is, in general, no guaranteed correspondence between references and players. For obtaining non-AudioPlayer devices like the speech device, use SpeechSimpleAudioDevice::GetInstance etc. instead.

Deprecated:
Parameters:
device ID of device
Returns:
device instance
Note:
VibratorDeviceID is used to access Vibrator class only for E-Gold based platforms (AudioVibratorDevice class) On all other platforms use directly the VibratorDevice class

static void AudioDeviceManager::MapAndUpdateVolumes (   )  [static]
 

SharedPtr< AudioActiveReference > AudioDeviceManager::Play (  const AudioReference &  file_reference  )  [static]
 

This is a convenience method, so that there is no need to get the player for the reference.

Parameters:
reference to be played
Returns:
NULL if unsuccessfull, otherwise AudioActiveReference which can control and stop the playback

Below is the table which contains all the messages which could be emitted by APOXI at the beginning, during and at the end of playback

AudioStartedMsgThis message will be emitted when a sound has started playing, i.e. the driver function to start playing has been called successfully
AudioStoppedMsgThis message will be emitted when a sound stops playing, it will not be emitted when the sound has been explicitly stopped
AudioSuspendedMsgThis message will be sent when sound is suspended by the audio priority manager, it will not be emitted when the sound has been explicitly suspended
AudioResumedMsgThis message will be emitted when a sound is resumed by the audio priority manager, it will not be emitted when the sound has been explicitly resumed
AudioRestartedMsgThis message will be emitted when a repeated sound is restarted
AudioStreamingSyncMsgIf the streaming instance was created using StreamAudioReference::CreateStream() function, the AudioStreamingSyncMsg APOXI Message will be sent after the first buffer is passed to DSP to be played

void AudioDeviceManager::PostAudioUserDefinedMessage (  UINT8  messageID,
UINT16  senderID = 0,
UINT32  param1 = 0,
UINT32  param2 = 0,
UINT32  param3 = 0,
UINT32  param4 = 0
)  [static]
 

Post the AudioUserDefinedMsg APOXI message.

Parameters:
messageID The user defined message ID, the meaning has to be defined at application level
senderID The sender ID, can be used when more application are sending the same user defined message ID, the meaning has to be defined at application level
param1 An user defined parameter, the meaning has to be defined at application level
param2 An user defined parameter, the meaning has to be defined at application level
param3 An user defined parameter, the meaning has to be defined at application level
param4 An user defined parameter, the meaning has to be defined at application level
Note:
This function sends an SDL signal to the PMI process and the receiving function will broadcast the AudioUserDefinedMsg APOXI message. The calling context of this function can be either an OS task or an OS HISR. It cannot be invoked from a LIHR. If the sender is supposed to be always an APOXI application then System::GetMessageRouter().Post method has to be used

BOOLEAN AudioDeviceManager::SetMasterVolume (  AudioDeviceBase::VolumeLevel  volume  )  [static]
 

Sets the master volume. Master volume affects all sounds.

Parameters:
volume Value between 0-100
Returns:
indicates success.

Parameters:

Returns:
The reference to the active recording, for use with StopRecording().

void AudioDeviceManager::StopAllSounds (   )  [static]
 

Stops all sounds, regardless of priority.

void AudioDeviceManager::StopRecording (  AudioActiveReference &  active_reference  )  [static]
 

Stops recording.

Parameters:
active_reference The reference to the active recording (obtained from StartRecording)

void AudioDeviceManager::SubscribeAudioMessageCallback (  OnAudioMessageCallback  func,
void *  pUserData = 0
) 
 

THIS FUNCTION IS OBSOLETE - If calling module is not an APOXI application, MessageHook should be used to receive the messages. Subscribes a message handler function that will be called in order to receive audio notifications. The registration of this function should be done only if the APOXI calling module is not an APOXI application so it cannot receive APOXI messages. Ex. Multimedia framework.

Parameters:
func The callback function to subscribe.
pUserData Opaque data that will be sent as a parameter to the callback function.

void AudioDeviceManager::SuspendAllPlayingSounds (   )  [static]
 

Suspends all playing sounds, regardless of priority. Sounds that cannot be suspended are stopped.

void AudioDeviceManager::UnsubscribeAudioMessageCallback (  OnAudioMessageCallback  func,
void *  pUserData = 0
) 
 

Unsubscribe the registered callback. See SubscribeAudioMessageCallback()

Parameters:
func The callback function to unsubscribe, previously provided to SubscribeAudioMessageCallback() pUserData The opaque data that was provided with SubscribeAudioMessageCallback()
